Grom-E1 rocket-powered glide-bomb in the direction of Zatoka, Odesa Oblast.
Explosion in Zatoka. Another one is flying in.
Another in Zatoka.
2 Kh-59 cruise missiles were launched, flying to Zatoka.
2 Kh-59 cruise missiles were launched, flying to Zatoka.
These were both Grom-E1s. Repeated explosions were heard.
2 more Grom-E1s have impacted. Gerans are now also attacking the same area.

Russian forces have captured the village of Sviato-Pokrovske, Rai-Oleksandrivka direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~426.
Total land area: ~1.96 km¬≤.
The fighting for Sviato-Pokrovske lasted approximately 18 days.
2 more Grom-E1s have impacted. Gerans are now also attacking the same area.

6 Grom-E1 rocket-powered glide-bombs and at least 18 Geran-2 drones targeted the Zatoka Bridge in Odesa Oblast. All of the glide-bombs and most of the drones impacted.
Coordinates: 46.07611, 30.46972

6 Grom-E1 rocket-powered glide-bombs and at least 18 Geran-2 drones targeted the Zatoka Bridge in Odesa Oblast. All of the glide-bombs and most of the drones impacted.
Coordinates: 46.07611, 30.46972

6 Grom-E1 rocket-powered glide-bombs and at least 18 Geran-2 drones targeted the Zatoka Bridge in Odesa Oblast. All of the glide-bombs and most of the drones impacted.  Coordinates: 46.07611, 30.46972

There are still at least 4 more Gerans out at sea, flying towards the bridge.
Additionally, an Orlan-10 reconnaissance drone is operating just off the coast, correcting and filming the strikes.
Rocket alert in Mefalsim and Nir Am
Rocket alert in Mefalsim and Nir Am
False alarm.
KABs to Zaporizhzhia City. Flying towards Rozumivka and the western suburbs.
KABs to Zaporizhzhia City. Flying towards Rozumivka and the western suburbs.
Repeated launches from Su-34s near Mykhailivka.
Explosions in Zaporizhzhia. These are the second strikes so far.

KABs are being launched from the area of Molochansk and Kalynivka from Su-34s at medium altitudes, flying along the vectors shown on the map. 
Impacts are recorded in Rozumivka/Nyzhnya Khortytsya, just outside Zaporizhzhia City.

Russian forces have crossed the Haichur River northwest of Hulyaipole and entered the treelines on its western bank, officially marking the start of the battles for Zaporizhzhia Raion (District).
Zaporizhzhia Raion was the second to last non-contested district in the 4 Oblasts claimed by Russia, and the last district that Russia never entered in the first place. Now only Beryslav Raion in Kherson Oblast remains.

Russian forces have crossed the Haichur River northwest of Hulyaipole and entered the treelines on its western bank, officially marking the start of the battles for Zaporizhzhia Raion (District).
Zaporizhzhia Raion was the second to last non-contested district in the 4 Oblasts claimed by Russia, and the last district that Russia never entered in the first place. Now only Beryslav Raion in Kherson Oblast remains.

Military Situation In Syria On December 13, 2025 (Map Update)

Ukraine Loses Half Of Huliaipole As Russian Army Presses On (Videos) 
On December 13, the Russian military expanded its control in Huliaipole in Zaporozhye to around half of the city amid what appears to be a complete collapse of Kiev forces there.
Advancing from the eastern part of Huliaipole, the Vostok [East] Group of Forces captured much of the city of the center. Russian troops also begin advancing in the southern part of the city, imposing control of most of the urban areas located there.
The Vostok Group of Forces also broke through Ukrainian defenses to the north of Huliaipole, physically blocking the main road along the Haichur River.
Read more

After Harsh Defeat In Siversk, Ukrainian Defenses Around City Are Collapsing (Videos)
On December 13, the Russian military began advancing from Siversk to nearby areas taking advantage of the chaos that emerged in the ranks of Kiev forces after losing the key city in Donetsk.
As Kiev forces fled their last positions in the western part of Siversk, the Yug [South] Group of Forces pressed forward without taking a pause, breaking through Ukrainian defenses to the south of the chalk quarry located right to the west of the city.

Attacker Who Killed Three Americans In Palmyra Was Member Of Syrian Security Forces
Two United States Army soldiers and a civilian interpreter were killed and three other soldiers were wounded on December 13 in an attack in the central Syrian city of Palmyra, the Central Command (CENTCOM) confirmed.
In a statement, the command said the attack by a lone gunman occurred "as the soldiers were conducting a key leader engagement" with Syrian security forces.
Reuters later reported, citing three local officials, that the gunman who carried out the attack was a member of the Syrian security forces.
Saleh al-Hamoui, a former commander of Hay‚Äôat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS) ‚Äì the Islamist rebel group that overthrew the Assad regime last year and established the current government ‚Äì was the first to reveal this.
In a post to Telegram, al-Hamoui said that the gunman was the bodyguard of Palmyra‚Äôs security chief, Abu Jaber ‚ÄúSufyan‚Äù. He was identified by other Islamist activists as ‚ÄúTariq Satouf al-Hamad‚Äù.

Sloviansk-Kramatorsk Front: Situation In Konstantynivka And Larger Ukrainian Defensive Area In Donbass
Russian forces are still on the offensive, pushing Ukrainian troops toward Sloviansk and Kramatorsk. In the Siversk sector, Russian troops entered the village of Ozerne and blocked two roads leading to Dibrova. 
Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orb√°n strongly criticized the European Union's plans to seize frozen Russian assets.

Southern Syria Is Starting To Follow The Path Of Its Lebanese Neighbors
At the end of November this year, the Zionist occupiers encountered localized resistance in the town of Beit Jinn, located southwest of Damascus at the foot of Mount Hermon. Casualties on both sides were roughly ten to ten, but the occupiers, as usual, fired at everything in sight and killed civilians.
Now, a bit of schizophrenia from the Zionist media. First, ‚ÄúIsraeli‚Äù media(‚Äúchannel 13‚Äù) claim that "the operation was carried out in coordination with Syrian security services," which again puts the al-Qaeda regime in an awkward position. In effect, the al-Julani regime has begun to implement Thomas Barrack's orders, when he previously stated that "the new Syria will now cooperate with the United States in the fight against Hezbollah and Hamas." Then other channels began to claim that at least one of the Syrian martyrs was allegedly connected to the Tahrir al-Sham regime's intelligence...
